result.execSummary:
The defendant Brett M Hoekstra was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders the restitution of $1,887.92 and costs of $188.79 be reduced to civil judgments.
Court orders the court costs of $453.00 be reduced to a civil judgment.
Sentence is to commence immediately.  Court grants huber, out of county service and out of county travel.  Court grants the defendant 63 days of sentence credit.

1:03 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Roeth has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  State has received a copy of the revocation packet, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing argument by DA Christenson.  Sentencing argument by Atty Roeth.  Statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-6 months county jail.
-Court grants huber, out of county service and out of county travel.
-Sentence is to commence immediately.

-Court grants the defendant 63 days of sentence credit.

Court orders the court costs of $641.79 and restitution of $1,887.92 be reduced to civil judgments.

Court adjourned at 1:10 p.m.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 3, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

and Revocation Summary

8:29 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - has not paid restitution.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  No statement by defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  SWD and places the defendent on probation for 1 year.

-Court costs.
-Restitution - $1,887.92
-DNA Sample

Court adjourned at 8:32 a.m.
Sentencing hearing on May 10, 2016 at 08:15 am.

3:32 P.M.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - paid restitution to the Clerk of Courts office but he can't find receipt.  Statement by DA regarding offer.  Statement by the Court.  Court goes over right to counsel.  Defendant waives right to counsel.  Court accepts waiver.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged.  Court orders counts 2-10 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Court sets for sentencing on May 10, 2016 at 8:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 3:38 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 3, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
